instance_template: loc("Station1"; "Junction1"; "Junction2"; "SubstationA"; "SubstationB"). edge("Station1", "Junction1"). edge("Station1", "Junction2"). edge("Junction1", "SubstationA"). edge("Junction2", "SubstationB"). edge("Junction1", "Junction2"). power(0..8). inspect("SubstationA"; "SubstationB").
generator: 1 { at(L, P) : loc(L) } 1 :- power(P). 1 { inspect_at(L, P) : power(P) } 1 :- inspect(L).

hard_constraints.description: Compliance requires that the drone's initial deployment must always be locked to Station1 at the start of the mission sequence.
Operational rules mandate that movement between intervals must follow the site's physical adjacency map; non-consecutive or unconnected jumps are a violation of safety protocols.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- at(L1, P), at(L2, P+1), not edge(L1, L2), not edge(L2, L1), L1 != L2.

hard_constraints.description: Company policy requires drone occupancy at a facility during an inspection window, specifically consuming a subsequent energy unit to fulfill technical capture requirements.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: at(L, P) :- inspect_at(L, P). at(L, P+1) :- inspect_at(L, P), P < 8.

hard_constraints.description: To prevent signal interference and ensure mission integrity, our compliance standards prohibit backtracking through Junction1 if Junction2 was navigated prior to the SubstationA inspection.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- at("Junction2", P1), at("SubstationA", P2), at("Junction1", P3), P1 < P2 < P3.

soft_constraints.description: Energy efficiency is a key performance indicator; the project manager requires the minimization of total power usage calculated at the point of final inspection completion.
soft_constraints.asp_rule: latest_inspect(P) :- P = #max{P1: inspect_at(_, P1)}. #minimize { P : latest_inspect(P) }.
